Overall, the higher accuracies were acheived when using the development data
as an evaluation file. The output of the liwc file had the highest accuracy, 63 percent,
when tested with the development data. The output of the opinion file had the second highest
accuracy with 61 percent.

TESTING NEW FEATURES:
A feature that I have tested out is whether there is a presence of stop words or not 
after lowering the tokens and removing tokens if they did not have one or more word 
characters. I tested it out with the training data as the default file and the 
eval file as the development data. As of right now it has yielded the strongest result 
with an accuracy of 65 percent, with the liwc output coming in at second with 63 percent 
accuracy.

The accuracy of imdb-development.data is: 0.65

The last feature I tried was using the word frequencies rather than the 
relative frequencies with ngram features. This was my best output, so I 
am using it for the competition.
